info.description:
This API provides programmatic access to read IATI data. The API responses are available in JSON, XML, CSV and XLS. By default the API response provides JSON ouput with the &format=JSON construct, but if you would like to output XML, CSV or XLS, you need to change that construct into that format.

# Available endpoints

* Activities: `api/activities/`
* Budget aggregation: `/api/budgets/aggregations`
* Codelists: `/api/codelists`
* Countries: `/api/countries`
* Current branch: `/api/branch`
* Datasets: `/api/datasets`
* Locations: `/api/locations`
* Organisations: `/api/organisations`
* Publishers: `/api/publishers`
* Regions: `/api/regions`
* Results aggregations: `/api/results/aggregations`
* Sectors: `/api/sectors`
* Transactions: `/api/transactions`


# XML export
If you require XML format from the API, simply use the format  &format=XML in your call. 

# CSV export
If you require CSV format from the API, simply use the format  &format=CSV in your call. 

# XLS export
If you require XLS format from the API, simply use the format  &format=XLS in your call. 

Not all the API calls have multi format support.
info.name: API Documentation

item.description: Returns a list of IATI Activities stored in the IATI Datastore based on 10 results as a default. You can retrieve up to `20` activities in a single call using the `&page_size=[nr]` option. If you want to go specific page, you can use `&page=[nr]` option. If the input value of `page_size` exceeds 20, the miximum limit number, which is 20,  will be returned.

Only activities that have specified fields will return. The parameter value is boolean, `True` or `False`.
This filter can be applied on the following fields:
- `crs_add`
- `other_identifier`
- `contact_info`
- `activity_scope`
- `recipient_country`
- `recipient_region`
- `location`
- `sector`
- `tag`
- `country_budget_item`
- `humanitarian_scope`
- `policy_marker`
- `collaboration_type`
- `default_flow_type`
- `default_finance_type`
- `default_aid_type`
- `default_tied_status`
- `budget`
- `planned_disbursement`
- `capital_spend`
- `document_link`
- `related_activity`
- `legacy_data`
- `condition`
- `result`
- `fss`
item.name: has_{field_name} (optional)

request.description: Filters `activities` by whether `crs-add` is present. The parameter value is boolean `True` or `False`.
Filters `activities` by whether `other-identifier` is present. The parameter value is boolean `True` or `False`.
Filters `activities` by whether `contact-info` is present. The parameter value is boolean `True` or `False`.
Filters `activities` by whether `activity-scope` is present. The parameter value is boolean `True` or `False`.
Filters `activities` by whether `recipient-country` is present. The parameter value is boolean `True` or `False`.
Filters `activities` by whether `recipient-region` is present. The parameter value is boolean `True` or `False`.
Comma separated list of activity scope codes. Returns `activities` that include given activity scope code(s).
Comma separated list of ISO2 country codes. Returns `activities` that include given recipient country code(s).
Comma separated list of region codes. Returns `activities` that include given recipient region codes(s).
Comma separated list of 5-digit sector codes.
Comma separated list of 3-digit sector codes. Returns `activities` that include given sector code(s).
Comma separated list of IATI Organisation Identifiers. Returns `activites` reported by these organisation(s).
Comma separated list of IATI Organisation Identifiers. Returns `activities` where the given organisation is reported as a participating organisation.
Returns `activities` with a total budget that is less than or equal to the given value.
Returns `activities` with a total budget that is greater than or equal to the given value.
Returns `activities` with a planned start date that is equal to or earlier than the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `activities` with a planned start date that is equal to or later than the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `activities` with an actual start date that is equal to or earlier than the gfiven value. Date must  be in `YYYY-MM-DD`
Returns `activities` with an actual start date that is equal to or later than the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `activities` with an actual end date that is equal to or earlier than the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `activities` with an actual end date that is equal to or later than the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Comma separated list of Activity Status codes. Returns `activities` with the given status code(s).
Comma separated list of activity hierarchies. Returns `activities` that are flagged as the given hierarchy.
Comma separated list of Activity IDs. Returns `activities` that report a related activity that has the given Activity ID(s).
Comma separated list of related activity type IDs. Returns `activities` that include a related activity that has the given related activity type code(s).
Comma separated list of ISO2 country codes. Returns `activities` that include a related activity that has the given recipient country code(s).
Comma separated list of region codes. Returns `activities` that include a related activity that has the given recipient region code(s).
Comma separated list of 5-digit sector codes. Returns `activities` that include a related activity that has the given sector code(s).
Comma separated list of default aid type codes. Returns `activities` that include given defualt aid type code(s).
Comma separated list of activity IDs. Returns `activities` where the given activity ID is included as a transaction provider activity.
Comma separate list of years. Returns `activities` that include an transaction with a transaction date within the given year(s).
Comma separated list of budget not provided codes. Returns `activities` that include the given budget not provided code(s).
Returns `activities` that include the given humanitarian scope type code(s).

Current available fields to display are:
* `url`
* `id`
* `iati_identifier`
* `reporting_organisation`
* `title`
* `descriptions`
* `participating_organisations`
* `other_identifier`
* `activity_status`
* `budget_not_provided`
* `activity_dates`
* `contact_info`
* `activity_scope`
* `recipient_countries`
* `recipient_regions`
* `locations`
* `sectors`
* `tag`
* `country_budget_items`
* `humanitarian`
* `humanitarian_scope`
* `policy_markers`
* `collaboration_type`
* `default_flow_type`
* `default_finance_type`
* `default_aid_type`
* `default_tied_status`
* `budgets`
* `planned_disbursements`
* `capital_spend`
* `transactions`
* `related_transactions`
* `document_links`
* `related_activities`
* `legacy_data`
* `conditions`
* `results`
* `crs_add`
* `fss`
* `last_updated_datetime`
* `xml_lang`
* `default_currency`
* `humanitarian`
* `hierarchy`
* `linked_data_uri`
* `secondary_reporter`
* `aggregations`
* `dataset`
* `publisher`
* `published_state`
* `transaction_types`

You can wrap them into a:

`&fields=url,id,iati_identifier,reporting_organisation,title,descriptions,participating_organisations,other_identifier,activity_status,budget_not_provided,activity_dates,contact_info,activity_scope,recipient_countries,recipient_regions,locations,sectors,tags,country_budget_items,humanitarian,humanitarian_scope,policy_markers,collaboration_type,default_flow_type,default_finance_type,default_aid_type,default_tied_status,budgets,planned_disbursements,capital_spend,related_transactions,document_links,related_activities,legacy_data,conditions,results,crs_add,fss,last_updated_datetime,xml_lang,default_currency,humanitarian,hierarchy,linked_data_uri,secondary_reporter,aggregations,dataset,publisher,published_state,transaction_types`.

To cover them all in once. `&fields=all` is on the docket.
to get activities that have certain elements, use `has_{field}=True` parameter. For example, to get activities that have `crs_add` element in them, the endpoint is: `https://test-datastore.iatistandard.org/api/activities/?has_crs_add=True&fields=crs_add&format=json`.

If the `fields` parameter is not specified or omitted, the default fields will be returned. The default fields are `iati_identifier`, `sectors`, `recipient_countries` and `recipient_regions`.
Returns `activities` that include the given sector vocabulary code(s).
Returns `activities` that include the given policy marker code(s).
Returns `activities` that include the given participating organisation type code(s).
Returns `activities` that include the given participating organisation role code(s).
Return `activities` where `secondary-reporter` is `True`. Boolean parameter value of `true`, `True`, `True`, `true`, `1` or `0` can be passed.

item.description:
API request may include `q` parameter. This parameter controls text search and contains expected value.

By default, searching is performed on the following fields. To search on subset of these fields the `q_fields` parameter can be used, like so; `q_fields=iati_identifier,title,description`.

* `iati_identifier` the IATI identifier
* `title` narratives
* `description` narratives
* `recipient_country` recipient country code and name
* `recipient_region` recipient region code and name
* `reporting_org` ref and narratives
* `sector` sector code and name
* `document_link` url, category and title narratives
* `participating_org` ref and narratives
* `other_identifier` owner ref and narratives
* `contact_info` all narratives for organisation, department, person name, job title & mailing address
* `location` ref of location
* `country_budget_items` narrative of budget item description
* `policy_marker` narratives of policy marker
* `transaction` ref and narratives of description, provider organisation, receiver organisation
* `related_activity` ref of related activity
* `conditions` narratives of condition
* `result` narratives for result title, result description, result indicator title, result indicator description, result indicator period target comment, result indicator period actual comment.
item.name: Text search

request.description: Search for a term in the IATI-Identifier field.
Search for a term in the Title field (narrative).
Search for a term in the Description field (narrative).
Search for a term in the recipient country field (name or code).
Search for a term in the recipient region field (name or code).
Search for a term in the reporting-org field (name or code).
Search for a term in the sector field (name or code).
Search for a term in the document link field (url, category or narratives).
Search for a term in the participating_org field (ref or narratives).
Search for a term in the other_identifier field (owner_org, ref or narratives).
Search for a term in the contact_info field (narratives, organisation, department, person_name, job_title, mailing_address).
Search for a term in the location field (ref).
Search for a term in the country budget items field (narrative).
Search for a term in the transaction field (`description narrative`, `provider_organisation`, `receiver_organisation`).
Search for a term in the policy marker field (narrative).
Search for a term in the related_activity field (ref).
Search for a term in the conditions field (narrative).
Search for a term in the result field (`title`, `description`, `indicator_title`, `indicator_description`, `indicator_period_target_comment`, `result_indicator_period_actual_comment`).

item.description:
API request may include `ordering` parameter. This parameter controls the order in which results are returned.

Results can be ordered by the following fields. The user may also specify reverse orderings by prefixing the field name with '-', like so: `-title`
item.name: Ordering

request.description: `start_date` is `actual_start_date` if it is available, otherwise `start_date` is `planned_start_date`.
`end_date` is `actual_end_date` if it is available, otherwise `end_date` is `planned_end_date`.

item.description:
API request has to include `group_by` parameter. Available options for `group_by` are:

- `recipient_country`
- `recipient_region`
- `sector`
- `related_activity`
- `reporting_organisation`
- `participating_organisation`
- `participating_organisation_type`
- `document_link_category`
- `document_link_file_format`
- `activity_status`


Available `aggregation` are:

-`count`
-`count_distinct`
item.name: Aggregation

request.description: Each item contains summarized information on the activity being shown, including the URI to activity details, which contain all information. To show more information in list view the fields parameter can be used. Example; `fields=activity_id,title,country,any_field`.

This request is for Activity CSV export. 

Note -  Activities are exploded according to the number of sectors in that activity. For example, if ther are three sectors in an activity, there would be 3 rows for each sector for parent activity. 
There will be 13 columns for transaction types. Related transaction value is aggregated in respective columns.

Multiple `recipient_countries` or `recipient_regions` could be in one cell if parent `activity` has multiple of them.

## Default columns
The following columns are default for CSV export. Other fields in the activity can be specified in `fields` parameter.

* `iati_identifier`
* `sectors`
* `recipient_regions`
* `recipient_countries`

item.name: Activity List  Hello

item.description:
Returns detailed information of the activity specified by `iati-identifier` of the activity.

## URL format
`/api/activities/{iati-identifier}`

Maximum of 100 `related_transactions` will display in `activity` endpoint. If an `activity` has more than 100 `related-transactions`, `transaction` endpoint should be used.

item.name: Activity Detail

item.description: Returns a list of IATI Datasets stored in the IATI Datastore based on 10 results as a default. You can retrieve up to `20` Dataset in a single call using the `&page_size=[nr]` option. If you want to go specific page, you can use `&page=[nr]` option. If the input value of `page_size` exceeds 20, the miximum limit number, which is 20,  will be returned.

request.description: Returns datasets with the given name(s).
Filter datasets by type (activity or organisation).
Returns datasets published by the given Publisher ID(s).
Returns datasets published by the given IATI Organisation ID(s).

item.description:
API request may include `ordering` parameter. This parameter controls the order in which results are returned.

Results can be ordered by all displayed fields except `activities `, `activity_count`, `file_type` and `internal_url`.

The user may also specify reverse orderings by prefixing the field name with '-', like so: `-publisher`.
item.name: Ordering

request.description: This is just an example request. DataSet can be ordered by by `name`,`title`,`filetype`,`publisher`,`url`,`source_url`,`activities`,`activity_count`, `date_created`, `date_updated`, `last_found_in_registry`, `iati_version`.
URI is constructed as follows: `/api/datasets/{name}`

item.name: Dataset List

item.description: Returns a list of Budgets stored in the IATI Datastore based on 10 results as a default. You can retrieve up to `20` budgets in a single call using the `&page_size=[nr]` option. If you want to go specific page, you can use `&page=[nr]` option. If the input value of `page_size` exceeds 20, the miximum limit number, which is 20,  will be returned.

request.description: Returns `budgets` within `activities` with the given activity scope code(s).
Returns `budgets` within `activities` with the given document link category code(s).
Returns `budgets` within `activities` with a planned start date which is less than or equal to the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `budgets` within `activities` with a planned start date which is greater than or equal to the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `budgets` within `activities` with an actual start date which is less than or equal to the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `budgets` within `activities` which include the given particpating_organisation(s).

Available fields are:
* `value`
* `type`
* `status`
* `activity`
* `period_start`
* `period_end`
* `activity_id`


The default fields are:
* `iati_identifier`
* `sectors`
* `recipient_regions`
* `budgets`

To get all fields, use `fields=all` parameter.

item.name: Budget List

item.description: Returns aggregations based on the item grouped by, and the selected aggregation.

API request has to include `group_by` parameter.

This parameter controls result aggregations and can be one or more (comma separated values) of:
item.name: Group by options

item.description:
API request has to include `aggregations` parameter.

This parameter controls result aggregations and can be one or more (comma separated values) of:

* `count` Count of budgets
* `activity_count` Count of activities
* `value` Sum of budget value (in the selected currency)

This parameter controls result aggregations and can be one or more (comma separated values) of:

* `target` Indicator period target. Currently breaks on non number results.
* `actual` Indicator period actual. Currently breaks on non number results.

All filters in `activity` endpoint can be used to filter transactions with regard to their activies.
item.name: Activity Filter

request.description: Returns `transactions` from the given Activity ID.
Returns `transactions` with the given aid type ID.
Returns `transactions` with the given transaction type code.
Returns `transactions` with the given transaction value.
Returns `transactions` with a `value` that is greater than or equal to the given amount.
Returns `transactions` with a `value` that is less than or equal to the given amount.
Returns `transactions` with a transaction date that is within the given year.
Returns `transactions` with a transaction date that is less than or equal to the given value. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
Returns `transactions` with the given provider activity ID.
Returns `transactions` with a transaction date that is greater than or equal to the given vaue. Date must be in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.
List of fields to display.
URI is constructed as follows: `/api/transactions/{transaction_id}`

item.name: Transaction List

item.description: All filters available on the Transaction List, can be used on aggregations.
item.name: Request parameters

item.description:
Returns aggregations based on the item grouped by, and the selected
    aggregation.

API request has to include `group_by` parameter.

This parameter controls result aggregations and
can be one or more (comma separated values) of:
* `recipient_country`
* `recipient_region`
* `sector`
* `related_activity`
* `transaction_type`
* `reporting_organisation`
* `participating_organisation`
* `receiver_org`
* `provider_org`
* `document_link_category`
* `activity_status`
* `participating_organisation_type`
* `collaboration_type`
* `default_flow_type`
* `default_finance_type`
* `default_aid_type`
* `default_tied_status`
* `transaction_date_month`
* `transaction_date_quarter`
* `transaction_date_year`
item.name: Group by option

item.description:
API request has to include `aggregations` parameter.

This parameter controls result aggregations and
can be one or more (comma separated values) of:

* `count`
* `activity_count`
* `value`
* `disbursement`
* `expenditure`
* `commitment`
* `incoming_fund`
* `incoming_commitment`
* `disbursement_expenditure` Disbursement and expenditure summed together.
item.name: Aggregations options

item.description: By default the values returned by the aggregations are in the reported currency. This only renders meaningful results when all values were in the same currency. Which is only the case when you filter your results down. The aggregation endpoints have the ability to return values in a currency. Options for this `convert_to` parameter are: * `xdr` * `usd` * `eur` * `gbp` * `jpy` * `cad` This results in converted values when the original value was in another currency. Information on used exchange rates can be found in the docs.

item.name: Count activity for each country, currently avaiable in DataStore
All Activity with Transaction Humanitarian is True
All Activity with Contact Email mosul@almortaqa.org
All Activity have budget 1 million or more
Get a big activity with more then 1000 transactions records  in JSON format, just in the couple seconds.

request.description:
This is using the faceting query: 
- https://lucene.apache.org/solr/guide/6_6/faceting.html#Faceting-CombiningFacetQueriesAndFacetRangesWithPivotFacets

Test SQL:
```
                SELECT
                    COUNT(DISTINCT(iati_activity.iati_identifier))
                FROM iati_activity, iati_activityreportingorganisation, iati_organisation_organisation, iati_activitydate
                WHERE iati_activity.id = iati_activityreportingorganisation.activity_id
                    AND iati_activityreportingorganisation.organisation_id = iati_organisation_organisation.id
                    AND iati_organisation_organisation.organisation_identifier = 'SE-0'
                    AND iati_activitydate.activity_id = iati_activity.id
                    AND iati_activitydate.iso_date >= '2000-01-01 00:00:00'::timestamp
                    AND iati_activitydate.iso_date <= '2000-12-31 24:00:00'::timestamp
                    AND iati_activity.humanitarian = true
```
